base_note.note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT - INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY
Date: 2025-11-04
Patient: Richard Thompson | MRN: 3060386 | DOB: 01/15/1957

Attending: Dr. James Walker, MD
Location: Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston, MA

PREOP DX: Recurrent tracheomalacia with carinal involvement, s/p prior metallic stent placement with stent-in-stent failure

POSTOP DX: Same

PROCEDURE: 
1. Rigid bronchoscopy
2. Removal of prior SEMS
3. Silicone Y-stent (Dumon) placement

ANESTHESIA: General, jet ventilation

PROCEDURE: Under GA with rigid bronchoscopy (14mm Dumon), the previously placed covered SEMS was removed using rigid forceps with en bloc extraction. Tracheomalacia confirmed with >75% collapse on expiration involving distal trachea and proximal mainstems bilaterally.

A Novatech silicone Y-stent (18mm trachea, 14mm bilateral limbs, 50mm body length) was loaded on the deployment rod. Under direct visualization, the Y-stent was advanced and deployed with the carinal spur appropriately positioned. Both mainstem limbs expanded well. Post-deployment bronchoscopy confirmed patent airways bilaterally, good stent positioning, no mucus impaction.

COMPLICATIONS: None
EBL: 10mL
DISPOSITION: PACU, discharge same day

Dr. James Walker, MD

coding_review.overall_assessment: Y-stent with bilateral limbs requires 31631 + 31637. Prior stent removal separately reportable.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of tracheal stent(s)
Bronchoscopy; each additional major bronchus stented (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with removal of foreign body

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31631, +31637, 31635; total_work_rvu=9.36, total_rvu=15.1 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Scott Baker
Medical Record Number: 6434015
Date of Birth: 01/15/1962
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-07-21

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with tracheomalacia with carinal involvement. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Airway Stent:
Airway stent deployment was executed with fluoroscopic and bronchoscopic guidance to ensure optimal positioning and mucosal apposition. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31631, 31637, 31635

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE - CODING DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

Patient: Kathleen Kelly | MRN: 4363896 | DOS: 2024-09-12

CPT CODE JUSTIFICATION
----------------------------------------

CPT 31631:
  Rationale: Tracheal portion of Y-stent placement
  Facility RVU: 6.94
  Facility Payment: $224

CPT 31637:
  Rationale: Additional mainstem stent limbs (add-on)
  Facility RVU: 3.01
  Facility Payment: $97

CPT 31635:
  Rationale: Prior SEMS removal
  Facility RVU: 5.54
  Facility Payment: $179

DOCUMENTED TECHNIQUES AND EQUIPMENT
----------------------------------------


PROCEDURE-SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION:

AIRWAY STENT:
  - Action: Placement
  - Stent Type: Y-Stent
  - Stent Brand: Novatech Silicone Y-Stent
  - Diameter Mm: 18
  - Length Mm: 50
  - Location: Carina (Y)
  - Indication: Tracheomalacia

TOTAL RVU SUMMARY:
----------------------------------------
  Total Facility RVU: 15.49
  Total Facility Payment: $500.0

Documentation supports medical necessity and procedure complexity as coded.

INDICATION:
Tracheomalacia with carinal involvement

CONSENT:

Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

General

None

To recovery, stable condition

[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-09-13, Kathleen Johnson, a None-year-old patient (MRN 3109057), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Tracheomalacia with carinal involvement. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included placement of Y-Stent. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The visualized airways appeared patent without significant abnormality. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is benign. 

Procedural coding: 31631, 31637, 31635.
